item.title: 'New road layout ahead' red rectangular sign not facing oncoming traffic on Crystal Palace Park Rd ahead of the jct with Thicket Rd., 10th February
item.description:
'New road layout ahead' red rectangular sign not facing oncoming traffic on Crystal Palace Park Rd ahead of the jct with Thicket Rd. It is situated near Rebecca Ct, 8, Crystal Palace Park Rd / the Telephone Exchange. Perhaps the sign is outdated as the 'new road layout' was installed over a year ago.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crystal Palace Park Road, Crystal Palace, Greater London

item.title: Continuous illegal parking outside the cafe/social club, 10th February
item.description:
Ever since the cafe on the corner of Sutherland Road completed refurbishment the volume of customers parking up on double yellows on both sides of Hertford Road has increased exponentially. This has become a daily occurance and is actively making resident parking worse and causing increased amounts of traffic as drivers turning in from Hertford Road either block the oncoming traffic waiting for cars to exit or cause jams by blocking Sutherland Road and then having to reverse onto Hertford Road to allow cars through.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sutherland Road, Edmonton, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sign post leaning into road, 10th February
item.description:
Hello, As you approach the traffic lights, junction with Lordship Lane and Barry Road. There’s a redundant sign post on the left leaning into the road and I took my mirror off. Please can it be removed? Regards Chris Baker
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 14, Valmar Road, Camberwell, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Hospital, 10th February
item.description:
Hello, I wanted to know if you could help me reduce the fine a little more, as I had an emergency appointment with my daughter and nowhere to park the car. I know it was my fault, but I couldn't miss the appointment because my daughter's ear was very painf

item.title: Incredible amount of litter down the street, 10th February
item.description:
I can’t convey how bad it is, I took many pictures on a 200 - 300 metre stretch of Cranwich Road. There is rubbish absolutely every where you look. Including broken glass in several places on the carriage way which will puncture tyres.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Cranwich Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
